rcl.name: Royal Caribbean
rcl.dress_description: No formal nights. Smart casual for dinner, casual during the day.

carnival.name: Carnival Cruise Line
carnival.dress_description: Very relaxed. Cruise casual dress code with optional Elegant Evening nights.

ncl.name: Norwegian Cruise Line
ncl.dress_description: Freestyle cruising - no dress code, no fixed dining times. Wear what you want.

msc.name: MSC Cruises
msc.dress_description: European style. Smart casual for dinner with optional gala nights.

celebrity.name: Celebrity Cruises
celebrity.dress_description: Evening Chic dress code. Smart casual to dressy for dinner, no formal nights required.

princess.name: Princess Cruises
princess.dress_description: Smart casual most nights with 2-3 formal optional nights per cruise.

holland.name: Holland America Line
holland.dress_description: Dressy to formal for Gala nights. Smart casual other evenings. Classic cruise elegance.

cunard.name: Cunard
cunard.dress_description: Traditional British elegance. Gala evenings with formal attire encouraged. Daytime casual, evenings dressy.

costa.name: Costa Cruises
costa.dress_description: Italian relaxed style. Casual dress most evenings with optional elegant nights.

virgin.name: Virgin Voyages
virgin.dress_description: No dress code at all. Wear whatever makes you feel good - from swimwear to evening glamour.

oceania.name: Oceania Cruises
oceania.dress_description: Country club casual. Smart casual for dinner, no formal nights. Refined but relaxed.

regent.name: Regent Seven Seas
regent.dress_description: Elegant casual most evenings. Optional formal nights on longer voyages. Understated luxury.

seabourn.name: Seabourn
seabourn.dress_description: Elegant casual always. No formal nights required. Sophisticated but comfortable.

silversea.name: Silversea Cruises
silversea.dress_description: Casual elegance. Smart casual to dressy for dinner. One or two optional formal nights.

explora.name: Explora Journeys
explora.dress_description: Modern luxury casual. No formal dress code. Effortless elegance encouraged.

icon.name: Icon Class
icon.description: The largest cruise ships ever built. Floating cities with neighborhoods, waterparks, and endless possibilities.

oasis.name: Oasis Class
oasis.description: Neighborhood-style mega-ships with Central Park, Boardwalk, and incredible variety. The original game-changers.

quantum.name: Quantum Class
quantum.description: Tech-forward ships with North Star, RipCord, and innovative dining. Modern without being overwhelming.

freedom.name: Freedom Class
freedom.description: Classic big-ship fun with FlowRider and solid amenities. Great value for the experience.

voyager.name: Voyager Class
voyager.description: The original revolutionaries. Still deliver a great Royal Caribbean experience at excellent value.

radiance.name: Radiance Class
radiance.description: Elegant mid-size ships with floor-to-ceiling glass. Perfect for scenic destinations and relaxed cruising.

vision.name: Vision Class
vision.description: Classic, intimate ships focused on the destination. Simple cruising done well.

excel.name: Excel Class
excel.description: Carnival's largest ships with 6,400+ guests. BOLT roller coaster, 20+ dining venues, themed zones. First LNG-powered Carnival ships.

vista.name: Vista Class
vista.description: The most family-friendly Carnival class. SkyRide, IMAX theater, Family Harbor zone, Havana section for adults.
best_for: Families with kids of all ages

dream.name: Dream Class
dream.description: Sweet spot between features and price. WaterWorks water park, comedy clubs, piano bars. Great for families and friend groups.

conquest.name: Conquest Class
conquest.description: Carnival's budget workhorses. 3,000 guests, solid core Carnival experience. Some have enhanced waterparks.

spirit.name: Spirit Class
spirit.description: Mid-size ships (2,100 guests) with highest percentage of balcony cabins. More intimate, can transit Panama Canal.

venice.name: Venice Class
venice.description: Costa ships transferred to Carnival with European flair. Italian design touches, refined atmosphere.

splendor.name: Splendor Class
splendor.description: Solo ship bridging Dream and Conquest classes. Good variety without mega-ship scale.

sunshine.name: Sunshine Class
sunshine.description: Refreshed older ships with modern Carnival touches. Serenity adult-only area, Guy's Burger Joint, RedFrog Pub.

fantasy.name: Fantasy Class
fantasy.description: Carnival's oldest and smallest active ships. Simple, no-frills cruising. Great value for short getaways.

prima.name: Prima Class
prima.description: NCL's newest, most upscale ships. Highest space-to-passenger ratio, 8-deck Haven complex, Indulge Food Hall, Ocean Boulevard.

breakaway_plus.name: Breakaway Plus Class
breakaway_plus.description: NCL's largest ships packed with activities. Go-karts, laser tag, Galaxy Pavilion VR, Broadway shows. Best dining variety in fleet.

breakaway.name: Breakaway Class
breakaway.description: Foundation for Breakaway Plus with slightly fewer features. Ropes course, Aqua Park, good nightlife.

epic.name: Epic Class
epic.description: Unique solo-focused ship with 128 Studio Staterooms and exclusive Studio Lounge. Large ship with ice bar, Cirque shows.

jewel.name: Jewel Class
jewel.description: Mid-size classics (2,400 guests) beloved by NCL loyalists. Relaxed resort feel, good specialty dining.

pride_of_america.name: Pride of America
pride_of_america.description: Hawaii specialist - the only cruise ship sailing year-round inter-island Hawaii itineraries. US-flagged, American crew.

dawn.name: Dawn Class
dawn.description: Early Freestyle Cruising ships (2001-2002). Quirky layouts, solid service. Good for destination-focused cruising.

sun.name: Sun Class
sun.description: Oldest active NCL ships. Smaller, more intimate, often all-inclusive deals. Sky specializes in short cruises.

spirit.name: Spirit Class
spirit.description: Fleet's oldest ship (1998 build). Well-maintained but lacking modern features. Classic cruising.

world.name: World Class
world.description: MSC's largest, newest flagships (~216,000 GT). Eataly restaurant, The Harbour family zone, bumper cars, Cliffhanger swing. LNG-powered.

meraviglia_plus.name: Meraviglia-Plus Class
meraviglia_plus.description: Large ships with covered LED promenade, Cirque shows, extensive dining. Indoor-focused design works well for varied weather.

seaside_evo.name: Seaside EVO Class
seaside_evo.description: Enhanced Seaside design with more outdoor space. Resort-style living, outdoor promenade, designed for warm-weather cruising.

meraviglia.name: Meraviglia Class
meraviglia.description: High-tech entertainment, stunning LED promenade, modern European city feel at sea. Strong Cirque shows.

seaside.name: Seaside Class
seaside.description: First MSC ships designed for warm-weather/outdoor cruising. Broad outdoor promenade, zipline, outdoor spa.

fantasia.name: Fantasia Class
fantasia.description: MSC's classic big ship class (130,000+ GT). European elegance, Yacht Club suites, showing age but well-maintained.

musica.name: Musica Class
musica.description: Mid-size ships with classic MSC d√©cor. Relaxed, international atmosphere. Good for itinerary-focused cruising.

lirica.name: Lirica Class
lirica.description: MSC's oldest ships (2003-2004, refurbished 2015). Smallest in fleet, intimate feel. Classic character retained.

edge.name: Edge Class
edge.description: Revolutionary design with Magic Carpet, Infinite Verandas, and Eden. Celebrity's newest and most innovative ships.

solstice.name: Solstice Class
solstice.description: First ships with real grass at sea (Lawn Club). Refined elegance with excellent dining and entertainment.

millennium.name: Millennium Class
millennium.description: Smaller, more intimate ships. Fully renovated with modern amenities while retaining classic elegance.

expedition.name: Expedition Class
expedition.description: Purpose-built for Galapagos. Ultra-luxury expedition with all-suite accommodations.

sphere.name: Sphere Class
sphere.description: Newest and largest Princess ships. Features The Dome and The Sphere with LNG power for sustainability.

royal.name: Royal Class
royal.description: MedallionClass technology. SeaWalk glass walkway, Sky Suites, and excellent dining options.

grand.name: Grand Class
grand.description: Princess's workhorse fleet. Proven design with Movies Under the Stars and excellent itineraries.

coral.name: Coral Class
coral.description: Panamax-sized for Panama Canal transit. Intimate atmosphere with CODLAG propulsion.

pinnacle.name: Pinnacle Class
pinnacle.description: Newest HAL ships with Music Walk, B.B. King's Blues Club, and Rolling Stone Rock Room.

signature.name: Signature Class
signature.description: Enhanced Vista design with additional deck. Three specialty restaurants and elegant public spaces.

vista.name: Vista Class
vista.description: Compass-named fleet (Noordam, Westerdam, etc.). Distinctive twin funnels and 67% verandah staterooms.

r_class.name: R Class
r_class.description: Smallest and oldest HAL ships. Access smaller ports, popular for Grand Voyages.

queen_mary_2.name: Queen Mary 2 Class
queen_mary_2.description: World's only ocean liner. Built for transatlantic crossings with strengthened bow and classic elegance.

pinnacle_cunard.name: Pinnacle Class
pinnacle_cunard.description: Newest Cunarder with modern amenities. Retractable glass roof pool and 15 restaurants.

vista_cunard.name: Vista Class
vista_cunard.description: Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth. Classic Cunard elegance with afternoon tea tradition.

excellence.name: Excellence Class
excellence.description: LNG-powered flagships. Italian-themed with each deck inspired by different Italian regions.

diadema.name: Diadema Class
diadema.description: Costa's entertainment flagship with 7 restaurants and 15 lounges. Mediterranean focus.

concordia.name: Concordia Class
concordia.description: Proven Italian design with recording studio (Pacifica), PlayStation World, and Grand Prix simulator.

luminosa.name: Luminosa Class
luminosa.description: Panamax specs for world cruises. Italian elegance with Murano glass and marble throughout.

lady.name: Lady Class
lady.description: Adults-only with no kids, no buffet, no main dining room. Rebellious luxury with 20+ eateries included.

allura.name: Allura Class
allura.description: Newest Oceania ships. 'Finest Cuisine at Sea' with exceptional personalized service.

oceania.name: Oceania Class
oceania.description: Marina and Riviera. First ships built specifically for Oceania with world-class cuisine.

regatta.name: Regatta Class
regatta.description: Smaller R-class ships. Intimate atmosphere with 70% verandah staterooms and four open-seating restaurants.

explorer.name: Explorer Class
explorer.description: All-suite, all-balcony ultra-luxury. Among the most opulent cruise ships ever built.

voyager_regent.name: Voyager Class
voyager_regent.description: Refined Penthouse Suites with modern touches. Classic Regent elegance throughout.

mariner_regent.name: Mariner Class
mariner_regent.description: Classic luxury with Chartreuse restaurant and Connoisseur Club. Timeless elegance.

navigator.name: Navigator Class
navigator.description: Smallest Regent ship. Yacht-like atmosphere with gorgeous teak pool deck.

prestige.name: Prestige Class
prestige.description: Next-generation ultra-luxury. 40% larger than Explorer class with only 10% more guests. Largest all-inclusive luxury suites at sea.

encore_seabourn.name: Encore Class
encore_seabourn.description: 300 luxury suites with all-balcony configuration. Enhanced amenities and high staff-to-guest ratio.

odyssey_seabourn.name: Odyssey Class
odyssey_seabourn.description: Just 458 guests for exceptional personalized service. Intimate yacht-like atmosphere.

venture.name: Venture Class
venture.description: PC6 Polar Class expedition ships. Ultra-luxury meets adventure with Arctic/Antarctic capability.

nova.name: Nova Class
nova.description: Highest space-to-passenger ratio in Silversea fleet. All-suite with butler service.

muse.name: Muse Class
muse.description: Mediterranean-inspired design with 8 dining options. All-suite luxury throughout.

spirit_silversea.name: Spirit Class
spirit_silversea.description: First new-class ship for Silversea. Enhanced amenities while maintaining intimate atmosphere.

millennium_silversea.name: Millennium Class
millennium_silversea.description: Classic Silversea elegance with spacious suites and exceptional space-to-passenger ratio.

expedition_silversea.name: Expedition Class
expedition_silversea.description: Ice-class expedition ships. Ultra-luxury meets adventure with PC6 capability.

explora.name: Explora Class
explora.description: 461 all-balcony suites with 1.25:1 passenger-to-crew ratio. Six restaurants and 12 bars/lounges.

explora_plus.name: Explora Plus Class
explora_plus.description: First LNG-powered ship in fleet. Enhanced sustainability with same ultra-luxury experience.
